Class SmugglersState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.controller.State.AdventureState
it.polimi.ingsw.gc11.controller.State.SmugglersStates.SmugglersState
public class SmugglersState extends AdventureState
Adventure state representing the resolution of a Smugglers encounter where players must compare their ship's firepower against that of the smugglers.

Each player, in turn, decides whether to activate double cannons using available batteries and calculates their total firepower. Depending on the result of the comparison with the smugglers' firepower, the player:

  • wins and receives a reward (handled in WinSmugglersState),
  • ties and passes the turn to the next player,
  • or loses, triggering material loss and potentially battery loss (handled in LooseBatteriesSmugglers).

The state automatically progresses to the next player or ends the encounter when all players have responded.

Invariants

  • gameModel != null
  • smugglers != null

  • Method Details

    • chooseFirePower

      public Player chooseFirePower(String username, Map<Battery,Integer> Batteries, List<Cannon> doubleCannons)
      Allows a player to respond to a Smugglers encounter by selecting which double cannons to activate and assigning the necessary number of batteries to power them.

      The method performs the following:

      1. Validates that the acting player is correct and the card hasn't already been resolved.
      2. Verifies that the number of batteries is sufficient to activate the selected double cannons.
      3. Computes the player's total firepower and compares it against the smugglers'.
      4. Transitions to the appropriate next state depending on win/tie/loss outcome.
      Overrides:
      chooseFirePower in class AdventureState
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player attempting to act
      Batteries - a map of Battery objects to integers indicating how many batteries are used
      doubleCannons - the list of Cannon (double cannons) the player wishes to activate
      Returns:
      the updated Player object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if:
      • the user is not the current player,
      • or the number of batteries is insufficient for the selected cannons
      NullPointerException - if Batteries or doubleCannons is null
      IllegalStateException - if the card has already been accepted for resolution
